law.catch_line: Criminal trespass in the first degree.

text.section: A person is guilty of criminal trespass in the first degree when he knowingly enters or remains unlawfully in a dwelling.
Criminal trespass in the first degree is a Class A misdemeanor.

law.history: Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 101, effective January 1, 1975.
